content: Sometimes our minds play tricks on us. We might see things in black and white, or imagine the worst possible outcome before it even happens. When a thought feels heavy, try to gently look for evidence against it. What if the opposite were true? What would you tell a friend who was thinking the same thing? You'd probably be a lot kinder to them than you are to yourself right now.
title: Challenging the Voice

content: It's easy to fall into the trap of 'mind-reading'â€”assuming we know what others are thinking of us. But usually, those assumptions are just our own fears talking. We can't actually see inside someone else's heart. Try to give yourself the benefit of the doubt today. You don't have to be perfect to be worthy of kindness.
title: The Mind-Reading Trap

content: If you're caught in a loop of 'what ifs', try to come back to the 'what is'. What is happening right now, in this second? You are breathing. You are here. The future hasn't happened yet, and you've navigated hard things before. You have a 100% success rate of getting through your hardest days.
title: What If vs What Is
